sourceMeaningMnemonic: When a <radical>tsunami</radical> comes, the <radical>brush</radical> makes a good safe <kanji>haven</kanji>. Thick brush is a haven from tsunamis because the brush will break the tsunami water and keep you safe and dry.
meaningInfo: Imagine being in the haven of a brush while a tsunami strikes. Hear the water crash and rush all around you while you remain safe in your haven.
readingMnemonic: The only downside about this <kanji>haven</kanji> is that there’s only room for <reading>two</reading> (<ja>つ</ja>) people in the brush. The brush isn’t big enough for more than two people, so unless you have a lot of brush, you won’t be saving many people from the tsunami.
readingInfo: Since there is room for two people in the brush, imagine yourself in the haven with one other person. They and you make two. The other person is a real whiner though - imagine them crying the whole time.
